channel.title: BBC News - Hampshire & Isle of Wight
channel.description: BBC News - Hampshire & Isle of Wight

image.title: BBC News - Hampshire & Isle of Wight

item.title: Frazer Brabant death: Man arrested on suspicion of murder
item.description: Frazer Brabant was found with serious head injuries in a back garden in Basingstoke in 2019.

item.title: Coronavirus: Case rates in Hampshire and Isle of Wight
item.description: The latest number of cases of Covid-19 across the two counties.

item.title: Hamble BP oil terminal entrance blocked by protesters
item.description: Environmental activists are protesting against the fossil fuel industry in Hamble, near Southampton.

item.title: Andrew Dymock: 'Malicious users' created terror group text chat
item.description: Andrew Dymock, 24, from Bath is accused of uploading racist and homophobic material online.

item.title: Portsmouth choirmaster trial: Mark Burgess guilty of abuse
item.description: Mark Burgess is found guilty by a jury of sexually abusing children in Hampshire and Sussex.

item.title: Swanwick Lakes rescue after two-year-old found unresponsive
item.description: A man is arrested after a toddler is pulled from water at a nature reserve.

item.title: Basingstoke police discuss stop and search laws with teens
item.description: Teenagers meet with police to discuss their experiences of stop and search racial profiling.

item.title: Hot air balloons soar over Isle of Wight
item.description: Hot air balloons have been taking to the skies over the Isle of Wight.

item.title: Memorial ride held for cyclists killed at New Forest junction
item.description: Mark Brummel and Kieran Dix died following separate crashes at the same crossroads in the New Forest.

item.title: Pilots train in lake for north Atlantic flight competition
item.description: Pilots and their crew members have been training before flying from Scotland to north-east Canada.

item.title: Isle of Wight council scraps prayers before meetings
item.description: The new chairman of Isle of Wight council orders an end to prayers at the start of meetings.

item.title: Southampton bus lane installed last year to be removed
item.description: Southampton City Council says the lane on Bitterne Road West increased journey times for cars.

item.title: Southampton rape: Man attacked by stranger in city thicket
item.description: A man is approached by two men in Southampton before being raped by one of them.

item.title: Isle of Wight Council appoints Independent Lora Peacey-Wilcox as new leader
item.description: Independent Lora Peacey-Wilcox replaces Conservative Dave Stewart who lost his seat on 6 May.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now reaching younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: Covid: How is Europe lifting lockdown restrictions?
item.description: A third Covid wave hit much of Europe hard but now gradually lockdowns are being eased.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and will they go ahead despite Covid?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics are due to start in July, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: 'Are you crying?' First mum-daughter hug in a year
item.description: Front-line NHS worker Viv Hudson hasn't hugged her daughter for over a year – until now.

item.title: Businesses split on plans to remove Southampton pedestrian zone
item.description: The businesses divided as Southampton's new council vows to reopen the streets that Covid closed.

item.title: Jonathan Taylor: Oil whistleblower's Monaco extradition bid upheld
item.description: Jonathan Taylor, stuck in Croatia since July, says the ruling is "illegal and illogical".

item.title: Freemasons: Young people 'on waiting lists' to join notoriously secretive society
item.description: The first report by Freemasons in 300 years shows it is popular with young people.

item.title: Covid 19: Isle of Wight cafe owner works at local hospital
item.description: When lockdown shut his Isle of Wight business, Kyle Freemantle began working at his local hospital.

item.title: Gosport mum calls for lower bus fares to help 'left-behind' town
item.description: A Gosport mum has called for lower bus fares to help residents of her "left-behind" neighbourhood.

item.title: King's Lynn Town 4-4 Aldershot Town
item.description: King's Lynn and Aldershot wrap up their National League campaigns with an entertaining eight-goal draw.

item.title: Solihull Moors 2-0 Eastleigh
item.description: Eastleigh's hopes of reaching the National League play-off hopes end with defeat at Solihull Moors.

item.title: Southampton FC: Twenty years since the last game at The Dell
item.description: Two decades on since Southampton Football Club left The Dell, players and fans share their memories.

item.title: Altrincham 1-1 Eastleigh
item.description: Eastleigh's National League play-off hopes are dented after being held to a draw at Altrincham.

item.title: Colin de Grandhomme: New Zealand all-rounder to join Hampshire for T20 Blast
item.description: New Zealand all-rounder Colin de Grandhomme will join Hampshire for the T20 Blast.
